remarks: The function ` F ` is the unique function defined by ` F `` [ x ] = A ` , provided that the well-definedness condition holds.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Dec-2016.)
statement:
qlift.1 $e |- F = ran ( x e. X |-> <. [ x ] R , A >. ) $.
qlift.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X ) -> A e. Y ) $.
qlift.3 $e |- ( ph -> R Er X ) $.
qlift.4 $e |- ( ph -> X e. _V ) $.
qliftfun.4 $e |- ( x = y -> A = B ) $.
qliftfun $p |- ( ph -> ( Fun F <-> A. x A. y ( x R y -> A = B ) ) ) $.
$d A y $.
$d B x $.
$d F y $.
$d R x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d Y x y $.
$d ph x y $.
